definitions.text:
Naughtiness
 Nautiness.
1. Badness; wickedness; evil principle or purpose. know thy pride and the naughtiness of thy heart. 1 Samuel 17:28.
2. Slight wickedness of children; perverseness; mischievousness.,

Nauty.
1. Wicked; corrupt. naughty person, wicked man, walketh with froward mouth. Proverbs 6:1.
2. Bad; worthless. The other basket had very naughty figs. Jeremiah 24:1.
3. Mischievous; perverse; froward; as naughty child. It is now seldom used except the latter sense, as applied to children.
